urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

text:
Important new research out today by @Jamie_Woodward_ & others identifies water firms as the main source of microplastics in UK rivers. 

Builds more pressure on government @EnvAgency to tackle the way water firms release untreated effluent into our rivers.
https://t.co/HKK1Ar0abP
@ClareNicklin @DrMickSalt @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids Yes otherwise the lorry drivers will be fined together with the company.
@davemh72 @SOPH_C_ @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency I'm hoping against hope it's a case of 'enough rope'  by Red Industries üôèüôè

@ClareNicklin @DrMickSalt @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids By law each loaded lorry has to have a consignment note with date, where the load came from and what the load consists of. The driver has to obtain a signature when loading and off loading the waste.

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency Tell them to visit Newcastle-under-Lyme and seen how much they connect with nature along with the stench of noxious gases from the landfill. They‚Äôll soon rush back from their lunch break to answer the many complaints from the community #StopTheStink
